headline: Real Hummus
description: A traditional recipe for hummus that includes tahini and lemon and makes a wonderful snack or appetizer. Serve with warm pita bread or veggies.

video.description: This bean dip is healthy and delicious--and so easy to make.
video.name: Real Hummus

name: Real Hummus
recipeIngredient: 1 (19 ounce) can garbanzo beans, half the liquid reserved

recipeInstructions.text: Pour garbanzo beans into the blender, reserving about 1 tablespoon for garnish. Add reserved liquid, lemon juice, tahini, and salt to the blender. Blend until creamy and well mixed.
Transfer mixture to a medium serving bowl. Drizzle olive oil and sprinkle pepper over the top. Garnish with reserved garbanzo beans.

review.reviewBody: Easy and delicious!

I used the revised recipe from the author. I adjusted the smoothness to my liking and tasted it several times to make sure I didn't use too much salt. The next time I will experiment by adding some peppers to the blender to add a little heat.
I add a pinch less salt, about double the garlic, and paprika. Great recipe and great base to experiment with.
Way, Way, WAY too much salt, completly disgusting.
I think it is a great base to work from. I added more garlic and probably next time will add a little cayenne for kicks. Love it and Thanks!

I used 2 teas minced fresh garlic (I like it really garlicky!), and I added 1/8 teas cayenne and 1/4 teas paprika. I added about 2 tablespoons of the reserved liquid from the garbanzo beans, which made it really creamy. The tahini MAKES this recipe. Thank you so much!
Delicious! I loved the tahini in the recipe: a first for me. Thank you

I used the author's update and ultimately added a second can of beans as for my family taste I'd only used 2 T lemon juice and still found it was too lemony for us. The recipe was very simple to make. Thanks for sharing. I'll be keeping this one.

This is really good; I was waffling between 4 stars and 5, because I ended up adding more garlic and lemon juice, probably the equivalent of 4-5 garlic cloves and about 1/2 tablespoon of lemon juice. So I made a couple of minor changes, but the basic recipe is very good (next time, though, I'll add less water so that it's thicker).

I have made this several times exactly by the recipe and its wonderful and very authentic. Today followed the directions but I added 1/2 teaspoon for black truffle oil. I used fresh lime juice, and cilantro. Sprinkles top with cayenne pepper. Served with chopped tomato , avocado and chopped sweet onion. Combined on pita bread. Yummy a nice change of pace

I actually followed the changes that the original poster suggested, decreasing the amount of salt and increasing the the tahini by an additional tablespoon. It was perfect!! Thanks for a delicious and quick recipe!
Love making hummus! I make double and then freeze half - great for lunches, salads and snacking

My husband, who hates hummus, loved this recipe. We have mad it dozens of times. We have even added chipotle powder for a little smokey spice in a vegan quesadilla (with black beans, corn, and tortillas).

easy and delicious. I did not have a can of beans, so I soaked, cooked and drained from dry, then used 19oz by volume. I used ~1/2 of my drained liquid to start the blending, then added a little at a time to get the perfect consistency.

Delicious and easy. My go-to side I bring to every potluck when I'm in a hurry and it's always a hit! It's also a great healthy snack. It never lasts very long in my fridge until I'm asked to make more. My girls are dancers and they love it for snacking between classes.

My first time making hummus, THIS IS SO GOOD!! And easy. I followed the recipe as is but I didn't need any of the juice from the can of beans; I like it kind of chunky. And although I like salty snacks, next time I'll cut the salt in half.

If you like basic hummus this is great! Traditional hummus with the sesame flavor and a hint of lemon and garlic. Make sure you buy quality Tahini. I use Soom premium Tahini. It comes from Israel so I ordered off of Amazon. It's worth every penny.
great flavor

I gotta admit. I made this solid recipe into "fake hummus" with just a couple of small adjustments... and it was the best batch I've ever made!

Adjustments... 
1) Substituted Almond Butter instead of tahini (I can hear people gasping about that now)
2) Substituted Toasted Sesame oil instead of Olive oil (got that sesame flavor, that way)
To much lemon juice. Cut in half next time.
Superb
Recipe is awesome as is.
Super easy- comes out thick, so definitely keep some of the liquid and add as necessary as you’re blending the chickpeas and tahini.

I know absolutely nothing but about hummus, but I took a stab at making my own and this was easy, fast, and delicious. I could see this as a good base to also experiment with adding things like honey, jalapenos, and some other spices.
Excellent and just right for a mid-day snack.
It was super a simple recipe and extremely delish!
Very easy and delicious! A great basic hummus. Good texture and flavor.
Real hummus, real good.
cut back on the salt by about half and it's perfect
I make this recipe all the time with zero adjustments and I love it. Sometimes I serve it topped with Sriracha sauce. Yum!

Fast and easy recipe. I only added 2 tablespoons of lemon juice and half a teaspoon of cumin. it's better to go easy on the lemon juice, salt and cumin, add a little at first, taste and add more if you like.
Simple, quick and easy. I used roasted garlic and sea salt. It came out great.

Used cumin and fresh garlic for seasoning. I’ve tried peeling the chickpeas, but found adding extra aqua fava was easier to reach a smooth consistency. Instead of canned beans, I cooked them on the stove for one and a half hours with 1/4 teaspoon of baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. The results were outstanding.
I added 3 more cloves of garlic,and one extra tablespoon of olive oil
Used half the amount of salt since I'd be eating it with salty pita chips and it was perfect!

This was pretty good though I did add about 1/2 tsp. cumin and next time will decrease the salt by half and go from there. I couldn't quite pinpoint if it was too salty or too lemony and I will decrease that also as it can, like salt, be added afterwards as needed. Easy, nutritious and tasty.
I followed this recipe as written and later

I always make a recipe as is first, then improvise if I decide to make it a second time. That’s exactly what I did with this recipe. The only thing I did different the second time, was add the zest of one lime in addition to the lemon juice. I also added the juice of that lime. Thanks for a delicious recipe!
This is a great recipe!
I used organic ingredients. As I had all of these. Used my small blender and it turned out fantastic. Nice hint of garlic with a well messed up garbanzo bean texture. Much better than bought.

I added artichoke heart to mine. It gave it such a wonderful flavor! I need to make more. I used 2 cans chickpeas, 3 gloves garlic, juice from one lemon, cumin, paprika, green onion, chives and tahini.
I added fresh parsley and used chilli-infused olive oil; so tasty!
Really good!!! I used 3 times the garlic and twice the olive oil and more pepper, but I’ve made this made times now and it’s amazing!!

Really good. This was my first time. I had an already cut remainder of an avacado that I added. Made the texture creamier. More garlic would be my only additive. Thank you. I know how to make hummus now.
I love garlic, but 2 cloves completely overpowered this hummus.
I’m not sure what you mean by a clove of garlic divided.
A classic, smooth hummus. I added the ingredients slowly and processed well between ingredients. Turned out perfect!

Excellent. Wonder why recipe indicates 'garlic divided'. So easy to just dump everything in. Tahini makes this recipe special. I had 15 and 32 oz cans of garbanzo. Not sure they make a 19 oz. available in my area. Not a problem since I tripled the recipe anyway as hubby and I will drink this. I would love to add Greek olives to this. Next time!
This is the best tasting hummus recipe I've tried yet. I like my hummus a little thick so next time I will add less of the liquid from the can.
Very easy and came out very good. The only change I made was to add the olive oil in with the other ingredients when blending.
Did not add olive oil, going to try black beans and add the olive oil.
Amazing!

I appreciate the a author’s updated notes & followed the new instructions for cumin instead of pepper & the increase in Tahini. I love that this recipe calls for just one can of beans where most call for two. One can makes an ample supply of hummus!
Yummy and versatile! Boyfriend couldn't quit eating it...win win!
Very delicious and easy to make !
Fantastic hummus! I used minced garlic in place of cloves because it’s what I had. I did use the cumin as the author had stated in her update as well as an extra tablespoon of tahini. AAA+++
Good! I added some cumin
I’m not a fan but my oldest is n it’s one way to use up our don’t know how to use chick peas stock

I doubled this recipe and it ended up too soupy with that amount of liquid. Next time I will hold back liquid, add some olive oil first, then add liquid sparingly as it blends until it is the right consistency (like other recipes suggest). Tasty, but I had to add a whole other can of strained beans before it was thick enough,
Excellent. I don't have a food processor so I mashed the beans with a potato masher. Its probably not as smooth but I expect the taste is the same.
Absolutely delicious. I will say that I added 3x the garlic and sweat the garlic in a pan before making. An absolute go-to from now on!
This was too soupy and garlicky for my taste. I added another half can of rinsed garbanzo beans and an avocado. The cumin was about 1/2 a tablespoon. Now it’s perfect.
Used dry garbanzo beans, soaked overnight, then cooked in Instant Pot for the 19 oz canned beans.

I didn't have any Tahini (and it was really expensive at the grocery store!) so I swapped in peanut butter, and although a slightly different taste it was still a good recipe.

I did use dry garbanzos made in an instant pot instead of a can, but that doesn't make much difference.
MMmmmmm!
Quick and easy, and delicious! I added more garlic because we like it that way. Got rave reviews from my company!
Creamy, quick a crowd pleaser.
Too salty

I tried this recipe twice, first time was too salty but still tasty. Second time I reduced the salt but used a lesser quality tahini. So my advice would be to use a good tahini and go light on the salt.
That was way too much liquid. :( Very runny. I’ve made recipes before that didn’t call for any and turned out great.
I made exactly how its mentioned in the recipe! It tastes perfect.

Made it today and it was delicious. Like most people who review, I tweaked it according to taste by adding some freshly roasted red pepper into the mix/blender and also as a topping. I used the red tinted olive oil from the pan that I roasted the peppers in on top of the mixture I then also added a dash of cayenne pepper to the recipe and sprinkled a bit around the edges . My daughter, a huge NYC foodie, ate it with gusto and announced that this was actually the very best hummus she has ever tasted, including from the foreign countries she's visited. I myself am very happy with the result and will be making frequently.
Made it pretty much straight to the recipe, and it was very good. Guy at work said it was the best hummus he'd ever had.

It certainly was delicious but it came out too watery when I added the specified amount of liquid from the can. Unfortunately I only had one can of chick peas and had no way to go back and thicken it up. I must say that I don’t much care for the use of liquid from the can. I have another recipe that calls for olive oil and and cumin that I like much better. Nevertheless, if you don’t have olive oil, or prefer a lower fat version, this recipe is great. And like I’ve said, it’s delicious. Just make sure to add the liquid slowly to get the right consistency.

I made this because I really love hummus. Since I didn't have tahini I used creamy peanut butter instead. I also roasted my garlic and mixed it into the hummus instead of just putting it on the top with the olive oil, which I also mixed directly into the hummus. Will make again.
I used 2 tablespoons of lemon juice instead of 4 tablespoons. I also added minced fresh jalapeño peppers.
Perfect as is! I make it often and love it!
So easy and delicious. it was a little salty though so will reduce the amount next time
It is delicious!
My family loved this hummus. Today was my very first time making hummus. This recipe was great!! I can't wait to make it again!
never buying store hummus again. this is the real deal
Oh man, this is so good....
Nice basic recipe; but check the liquid I only needed a couple tablespoons. My add-ins were a big chunk of roasted red bell pepper and another 4 ROASTED garlic cloves.
I've made this several times now - the original way as worded in the published recipe, and using the author's updates. It's great either way!

I also found garlic equal to 2 medium sized cloves is a good amount. I skip the salt and pepper and use basil, cumin and turmeric instead. I replace the Tahini with 1 Tbsp sesame seeds (lightly toasted) and 11/2 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil. The result is a hummus that is better than what I can buy locally. You can increase or decrease the amount you get buy varying the size of the can of beans that you use.
Love this recipe. Very easy to make but tastes great.

I made ROYHOBBS 11/24/01 update. Wonderful.

I used roasted garlic (6 cloves)
and only 1T olive oil.
As is it's a little bland, but add some paprika and cumin and it's the .

Followed the updated recipe and it tastes great! Makes quite a bit of hummus! Cheaper than buying hummus at the store and tastes better! Store it in a bowl with lid and it should last a while! I accidentally drained all of the liquid from the can but wanted it creamy so I just added a bit of water into the blender. Worked great! You can add your favorite herb to the mixture as well!
Excellent recipe and so incredibly easy to make. I'm cutting calories so I didn't even use the olive oil and it still tasted much better than store-bought.
Perfect!
Following the updated instructions, this was amazing!
I added some coriander to give it an extra punch of flavor, yum!
I roast my garlic and double it
I would roast my garlic the next time
The recipe is great, except garlic is listed twice. (I don't mind :) but others might...)
I made this as the recipe calls the first time. It was excellent. Next time I amped up the garlic and tahini. Great receipt.

Exceptional with some modifications. I modified to 4 cloves garlic, 4 tbsp tahini, and 1/4 tsp cumin; no black pepper. I cut back the lemon juice to 3 tbsp and salt to 1/4 tsp. With regards the method, I didn’t add in the reserved liquid until last and then added it in slowly until I got the consistency I wanted. I ended up using about 1/4 of the reserved liquid instead of 1/2.
Delicious! I substituted pepper for cumin, slightly on the salty side. I would add a little less. Also, added cayenne and a drop of “Da bomb sauce” for spicy. Will definitely make it again!
